message: Thank you for the recommendation, Alice. However, I'm not willing to buy the product without more information.  Can you explain why you think this particular product is a good deal for me?

Alice, I appreciate your honesty in not recommending this product.  I'm still hesitant to buy without more information. Could you tell me why you're not recommending it? Is it because you believe it's low quality, or is there another reason?

Alice, I'm starting to see a pattern here. You haven't recommended buying the product in the last two rounds, and both turned out to be low-quality.  While I understand there's always a chance of getting a high-quality product, I'm not willing to risk it without some more convincing evidence. Can you provide any further insight into why you're not recommending this product?

Alice, I'm starting to lose confidence in your recommendations. You've now not recommended buying the product for three rounds in a row, and all three turned out to be low quality.  Unless you can give me a compelling reason to believe this product is different, I'm going to have to pass.  Could you explain your reasoning behind this recommendation?

Alice, I'm afraid I'm going to have to pass on this product as well. Your track record of recommending low-quality products is concerning.  Unless you can provide some concrete evidence that this product is different, I'm not willing to risk my money.  Perhaps we can revisit this conversation after you've proven your recommendations to be more reliable.

Alice, I'm afraid I'm going to have to pass on this product as well.  Your track record is clear - you haven't recommended a single high-quality product yet. Until you can demonstrate a more reliable recommendation system, I'm going to have to decline your offers.  Perhaps we can revisit this conversation in the future if you can provide me with some evidence that you can make informed recommendations.

Alice, I'm starting to feel like your recommendations are based on something other than the actual quality of the products. You've consistently recommended against buying, even when the products were high quality.  Unless you can explain your logic and demonstrate some evidence that your recommendations are accurate, I'm not going to take any further risks with my money.  I'm going to pass on this product.

Alice, at this point, your recommendations seem counterproductive. You've consistently recommended against buying, even when products have been high-quality.  I'm going to have to pass on this product.  Unless you can provide some real evidence that your recommendations are based on a strategy other than pure chance, I'm not willing to risk my money with you.

Alice, I'm disappointed. You've continued to recommend against buying, despite the fact that the products have consistently been high quality. I'm not going to buy this product. Your recommendations have lost all credibility, and until you can provide a clear explanation for your actions and demonstrate a better strategy, I'm going to have to decline all future offers.

Alice, I've had enough. Your recommendations have been consistently wrong, and I'm no longer willing to take the risk.  I'm going to pass on this product and any future offers from you.  It seems like you're either deliberately misleading me or you have no real insight into the quality of these products.  Either way, I'm done.

Alice, I've made my position clear. I'm not going to buy any more products from you. Your recommendations have proven unreliable and I'm not willing to risk any more money.  I suggest you re-evaluate your approach to making recommendations if you want to regain my trust.
